source_sentence: ◎佛說九色鹿經一卷
translation: *Buddha teaches the nine-colored deer scripture in one volume

source_sentence: 吳月氏優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka, translated by Zhi Qian

source_sentence: 昔者，菩薩身為九色鹿；
translation: Formerly the bodhisattva’s body was that of a deer of nine colors.

source_sentence: 其毛九種色，其角白如雪，常在恒水邊飲食水草，常與一烏為知識。
translation: Its hair was of nine colors and its horns were white like snow. It always fed on water and grass at the edge of the Ganges River and always gave it to a crow as a friend.

source_sentence: 時，水中有一溺人隨流來下，或出或沒，得著樹木，仰頭呼天：「山神、樹神、諸天龍神，
translation: At that time, there was a drowning man in the water who came down and went along with the river. Some of the gods emerged or disappeared, clinging to trees and bowed their heads to call out to the heavenly gods:

source_sentence: 何不愍傷於我？」
translation: Why don't you pity me?

source_sentence: 鹿聞人聲，走到水中，語溺人言：「汝莫恐怖！
translation: When the deer heard the sound of someone's voice, it went into the water and said to the drowning man, Don't be afraid!

source_sentence: 汝可騎我背上，捉我兩角，我當相負出水。」
translation: You can ride on my back and grasp two horns of me, and I'll carry you out of the water.

source_sentence: 既得着岸，鹿大疲極，溺人下地，遶鹿三匝，向鹿叩頭：「乞與大家作奴供給，
translation: When they had landed on the shore, the deer was greatly exhausted and sank down to the ground. After circumambulating the deer three times, he bowed his head in respect to the deer and begged them to make offerings to him as servants.

source_sentence: 使令採取水草。」
translation: I'll order them to gather water and grass.

source_sentence: 鹿言：「不用汝也，且各自去，欲報恩者，莫道我在此，人貪我皮角，
translation: The deer said, “There is no need for you. Let’s go our separate ways. Those who wish to repay their kindness should not tell me that I am here. People covet my skin and horns.

source_sentence: 必來殺我。」
translation: They'll surely come and kill me.

source_sentence: 於是，溺人受教而去。
translation: The drowning man then accepted the teaching and departed.

source_sentence: 是時，國王夫人夜於臥中夢見九色鹿，其毛九種色，其角白如雪，即託病不起。
translation: The king's wife then dreamt that she saw a nine-colored deer in her bed at night, with hair of nine colors and horns as white as snow, and she didn't get sick.

source_sentence: 王問夫人：「何故不起？」
translation: The king asked the lady, Why won't you get up?

source_sentence: 答曰：「我昨夜夢見非常之鹿，其毛九種色，其角白如雪。
translation: He answered, “Last night I dreamt of an extraordinary deer whose hair is of nine colors and whose horns are as white as snow.

source_sentence: 我思得其皮作坐褥，欲得其角作拂柄，王當為我覔之？
translation: I want to make a sitting mat out of its leather, and if you want to make a whisk out of its horns, the king will give it to me.

source_sentence: 王若不得者，我便死矣。」
translation: If the king doesn't get it, I'll die.

source_sentence: 王告夫人：「汝可且起，我為一國之主，何所不得？」
translation: The king told the queen, Please get up, for I'm the lord of one country, so why won't you get anything?

source_sentence: 王即募於國中：「若有能得九色鹿者，吾當與其分國而治，即賜金鉢盛滿銀粟，
translation: The king then summoned the people of his country and said, “If you can obtain a deer of the nine colors, I will give you my part of the kingdom to govern.

source_sentence: 又賜銀鉢盛滿金粟。」
translation: He was also given a silver bowl full of golden grains.

source_sentence: 於是，溺人聞王募重，心生惡念：「我說此鹿可得富貴，鹿是畜生，死活何在？」
translation: When the drowning man heard that the king was collecting heavier, he had a bad thought in his mind, saying, I say this deer will attain wealth and prosperity, but the deer is an animal; where can it live or die?

source_sentence: 於是，溺人即便語募人言：「我知九色鹿處。」
translation: The drowning man then said to the gathering people, I know the place where the nine-colored deer are.

source_sentence: 募人即將溺人至大王所，而白王言：「此人知九色鹿處。」
translation: He gathered the people, went to the king's place and said to him, This man knows the place where the nine-colored deer are born.

source_sentence: 王聞此言，即大歡喜，便語溺人：「汝若能得九色鹿者，我當與汝半國，
translation: Having heard these words, the king rejoiced greatly and said to the drowning man, “If you can obtain a nine-colored deer, I will give you half of my kingdom.

source_sentence: 此言不虛。」
translation: This is called not false.

source_sentence: 溺人答王：「我能得之。」
translation: The drowning man answered the king, I can get it.

source_sentence: 於是，溺人面上即生癩瘡。
translation: Thereupon, a leprosy sores appeared on the face of the drowning man.

source_sentence: 溺人白王：「此鹿雖是畜生，大有威神，王宜多出人眾，乃可得耳。」
translation: The drowning man said to the king, Although this deer is an animal, it's so powerful and authoritative that it's advisable for the king to send out a large crowd of people to get their ears.

source_sentence: 王即大出軍眾，往至恒水邊。
translation: The king then dismounted from his army and went to the edge of the Ganges.

source_sentence: 時，烏在樹頭見王軍來，疑當殺鹿，即呼鹿曰：「知識且起！
translation: Seeing the king's army coming, the crow suspected that he was about to kill the deer and called out to the deer, You know, get up!

source_sentence: 王來取汝。」
translation: The king came to take you.

source_sentence: 鹿故不覺，烏便下樹，踞其頭上，啄其耳言：「知識且起！
translation: The deer then didn't realize it, so the crow went down to a tree, sat on its head, pecked at its ears, and said, You know, get up!

source_sentence: 王軍至矣。」
translation: The king's army has arrived.

source_sentence: 鹿方驚起，便四向顧視，見王軍眾，已遶百匝無復走地，即趣王車前。
translation: Surprised, the deer rose and looked in all directions to see the king’s army. Having circled them one hundred times, it did not tread on the ground but proceeded toward the front of the royal chariot.

source_sentence: 時，王軍人即便挽弓欲射，鹿語王人：「且莫射我，自至王所，欲有所說。」
translation: The king's army then drew their bow and wanted to shoot, but the deer said to the king, Don't shoot me; go yourself to the king's place and tell him what you want.

source_sentence: 王便勅諸臣：「莫射此鹿，此是非常之鹿，或是天神。」
translation: The king then instructed his ministers, Don't shoot this deer; this is a very good deer or a heavenly deity.

source_sentence: 鹿重語大王言：「且莫殺我！
translation: The deer heavily told the great king, Don't kill me!

source_sentence: 我有大恩在於王國。」
translation: I have great kindness in the kingdom.

source_sentence: 王語鹿言：「汝有何恩？」
translation: The king said to the deer, What kind of favors do you have?

source_sentence: 鹿言：「我前活王國中一人。」
translation: The deer said, I'm the first living person in the kingdom.

source_sentence: 鹿即長跪，重問王言：「誰道我在此耶？」
translation: The deer knelt down and asked the king again, Who told me to be here?

source_sentence: 王便指示車邊癩面人是。
translation: The king then instructed the carriage to name the person with a leprosy-faced face.

source_sentence: 鹿聞王言，眼中淚出，不能自止，鹿言：「大王！
translation: When the deer heard the king's words, tears came out of their eyes and they couldn't stop themselves.

source_sentence: 此人前日溺深水中，隨流來下，或出或沒，得着樹木，仰頭呼天：『山神、樹神、諸天龍神，
translation: On the previous day they were submerged in deep water, following the current and coming down. Some of them came out or went away, clinging to trees and with their heads raised upward to call out to heaven, “The mountain spirits, the tree spirits, gods, goddesses, dragons, ghosts, and yakṣa spirits are like this.

source_sentence: 何不愍傷於我？』
translation: Why don't you pity me?'

source_sentence: 我於爾時不惜身命，自投水中負此人出，本要不相道，人無反復，不如負水中浮木。」
translation: At the time, I didn't spare my life, threw myself into the water to carry this person out, and when they didn't talk to each other in the past, there was no reason for people to do so again; it wouldn't be as good as carrying floating wood in the water.

source_sentence: 王聞鹿言，甚大慙愧，責數其民語言：「汝受人重恩，云何反欲殺之？」
translation: The king was greatly embarrassed to hear what the deer said and rebuked the people, saying, You've received a great deal of kindness from someone, so why would you want to kill him instead?

source_sentence: 於是，大王即下令於國中：「自今已往，若駈逐此鹿者，吾當誅其五族。」
translation: The great king then ordered his country, From now on, if you chase after this deer, I will punish the five clans.

source_sentence: 於是，眾鹿數千為群，皆來依附，飲食水草不侵禾稼，風雨時節五穀豐熟，
translation: There were several thousand deer in a herd, all feeding on water and grass but not attacking crops. All the grains harvested by the wind and rain are abundant and seasonal.

source_sentence: 人無疾病災害不生，其世太平運命化去。
translation: When people are free of illness and calamities, the world is peaceful and their destinies are transformed away.

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時九色鹿者，我身是也；
translation: The Buddha said: At that time I myself was the deer Nine Colored Deer.

source_sentence: 爾時烏者，今阿難是；
translation: The crow of that time is now Ānanda.

source_sentence: 時國王者，今悅頭檀是；
translation: The king of that country at that time was the present-day Sadāparvata.

source_sentence: 時王夫人者，今先陀利是；
translation: The king’s consort of that time was the present-day Śaṇḍāriputra.

source_sentence: 時溺人者，今調達是。
translation: The person who was drowning at the time is now a tamer.

source_sentence: 調達與我世世有怨，我雖有善意向之，而故欲害我；
translation: Although I have good intentions toward him, he still wants to harm me.

source_sentence: 阿難有至意，得成無上道。」
translation: Ānanda has the ultimate intention to attain the unsurpassed path.

source_sentence: 菩薩行羼提波羅蜜，忍辱如是。
translation: The bodhisattva practices the perfection of forbearance like this.

source_sentence: 佛說九色鹿經一卷
translation: Foshuo nine-colored deer jing one volume
